name: Boudewijn Filterapp
description: This project was made for Boudewijn Seapark. It keeps track of what employees do certain tasks, where and when. It was a group project in teams of 3, and it took us about 2 and a half months and more than 20.000 lines of code to complete.

We made a login and register page for the employees where they can create their account and login with a pincode. They can complete general, daily, weekly and monthly tasks, and see a progressbar for each department.

There are daily water analyses to measure for example the temperature and acidity of each pool. If a certain measurement does not meet the quota of the maximum or minimum value, everyone will receive a notification about that measurement.
The admin has the authority to see, create, update and delete tasks, users and measurement definitions. There is also an option to export all the task data to Excel.

name: Aero Kanban
description: This was my first project while learning React. A basic Kanban Task app with a Strapi server, and possibilities to read, add, edit and delete tasks. All within a React interface styled to resemble Windows 7.

All tasks have a category, which also can be created. You can search in realtime for tasks in the search bar, and filter based on task labels. There also is a backlog with pagination, for access to unused tasks.
For the overall styling, I was inspired by the nostalgic charm and Frutiger Aero aesthetic of Windows 7, using glassy surfaces, radiant hues, and a futuristic feel. Taking a trip down memory lane.

name: First Portfolio
description: I used CraftCMS, a content managing system, for the first time while making this project. So i could update the content without writing any more code. This project is an exercise in making websites as accessible as possible
The website consists of multiple pages like home, about, projects and contact. These are all automatically loaded with the content form CraftCMS.
This was my first project where I made the webpage fully accessible using semantic HTML and correct ARIA-roles. This allows a better user experience for everyone.
